The following European Tour alongside Iced Earth totally fulfilled the high expectations, created by an already overwhelming reaction from the metal press.

In 1999 the vocalist position became vacant, but the band managed to fill it with one of the best metal frontmen worldwide, Andy B. Franck. Finally everything was falling into place, and the band signed a contract with Metal Blade Records. In October 2001 the band released ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œMetus MortisÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, a high-energy metal classic produced by Achim KÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶hler, which became Album of the Month in several metal magazines worldwide, paving the way for another successful tour as well as many festival gigs and shows across Europe.

In March 2003 the band returned to the studio to record ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSoul TemptationÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, the fifth album in their career. What followed the release can only be described as a triumph for the band: Several chart entries, a massive European tour and festival shows all over the world resulted in the bandÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s definitive incorporation to the WorldÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Champions League of Metal. BRAINSTORM had finally arrived where they belong ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ at the top!

So now time to take a break? No way! With the incredible energy and atmosphere from their live shows still fresh in their minds, the band began writing new material. From November 2004 on, the band started recording their new album again with Achim KÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶hler in their usual working environment. The single ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œAll Those WordsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ was released on March 7, meant as an appetizer for the fans before the full album was launched on April 4. Again, several chart entries all over Europe followed.

Their following first headlining tour through Europe was an overwhelming success, seeing the band touring constantly for over a year and a half, including all the important festivals and such. At the end of 2006 the band started work on their 10 years of BRAINSTORM albums festivities for 2007, which included the re-release of their first two albums, ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œHungryÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ and ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œUnholyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½, and the first ever double DVD ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œHoney from the BÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢sÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ with a duration of over 5 hours of pure BRAINSTORM Power. The DVD was highly praised by fans and media, entering several DVD charts again and shortening the wait for the new album with another successful release.

The new albumÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s preceeding single ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œFire Walk With MeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ was released in October 2007 and topped the Hungarian charts in its week of release.

Now, after 2 1/2 years of wait, BRAINSTORM have recorded their long awaited new album ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œDownburstÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ with producers Sascha Paeth and Miro, which will be released in January 2008. And BRAINSTORM is stronger than ever. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œDownburstÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ will not only satisfy the needs of their followers, it will surprise many and even convince the non-believers! All songs show the incredible songwriting talent of the band members and prove once more why this band has been up and running for over a decade now and for sure is here to stay! The songs range from fast, hard and double-kick-driven bastards to epic soundscapes to melodic metal hymns. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œDownburstÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ is a beautiful beast, a real ball of steel but also an emotional masterpiece with no fillersÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ just killers!
